reviews.text: We did this as part of a day tour from Hanoi, the bay is beautiful, we are so glad we visited this UNESCO heritage site - we saw lots of references to rubbish, which was really off putting , but would like to say that we only saw one plastic bottle , so don't let this out you off . We also got to swim in the bay - how many times in your life will you get that experience. Will have a look and see who we booked with and review this company as it was a great all-round day .
Amazing place all the pictures cannot capture all of its beauty.
Amazing place...definitely worth a visit
Beautiful

Anyone who thinks that they alone come up with the idea of ​​watching this natural spectacle is absolutely right. Don't be put off by the many tourists at the port.

No jokes aside, the bay is of course very “exploited” for tourism. The water isn't exactly ideal for swimming either. But the beauty of the bay is undeniable. The weather has to cooperate, it's not uncommon for clouds to hang in Halong Bay.

We had a 3 day cruise here and it was so worth it. Hence the 5 stars.

reviews.text: Quang Ninh Museum is an intriguing destination for those interested in exploring local culture and history. I was impressed by the collection of valuable historical artifacts and insightful information on display. However, the museum could benefit from better organization and space utilization. Some areas seemed a bit disorganized and lacking in cleanliness. Hopefully, in the future, the museum will be managed and arranged more effectively to enhance the visitor experience.

A stop-by place for tourist at Ha Long city. There are many specimens to explore. The first floor is for display ocean species. The second floor is decorated like a boat with historical item from the war. The third floor is display with cultural theme. The black appearance outside is very unique and attractive

Interesting museum and very beautiful, hot in sections but I don’t mind sweating!
Good for a half day while in Halong

Worst museum I’ve ever been to. This place looks like they set it up 10 years ago and never touched or cleaned it ever again. This place has never seen a mop or dust rag. Or known a graffix designer to put some good signs to educate the visitors. It’s basically every species ever found in Vietnam, killed and stuffed and pinned in a glass container or put in a preservative fluid of some sort and they’re falling off and poorly stuffed.
Only gave it some stars because they had some interesting war things, nice view to the sea and nice bonsai trees outside.
Staff was all nice to us too. Very helpful.
Beautiful scenery, right by the beach with paved walkway along the coast.

data.formatted_address: Ha Long Bay, Halong City
data.name: Sung Sot Cave

reviews.text: Visiting Sung Sot Cave was an incredible experience. The cave is vast and majestic, requiring a bit of a hike to reach the entrance. Once inside, you'll be greeted by expansive chambers illuminated by a carefully designed lighting system that enhances the cave's natural beauty. Despite the rain during our visit, the journey was well worth it. The cave’s sheer scale and the stunning light effects make it a truly unique and memorable attraction. It’s a once-in-a-lifetime experience that I highly recommend, though be prepared for the crowds of tourists.

A Stunning Natural Wonder

Sung Sot Cave, also known as Surprise Cave, is an absolute marvel and a highlight of our trip to Ha Long Bay. The cave is massive, with two main chambers that are both impressive and breathtaking. The first chamber is quite spacious and leads to an even larger second chamber, which truly lives up to the cave’s name.

The rock formations are incredible, and the lighting inside the cave highlights the stalactites and stalagmites beautifully. It’s easy to see why this cave is so popular. The walking path is well-maintained and offers plenty of spots to stop and take photos. Our guide provided interesting information about the cave’s history and geology, which enhanced the experience.

The views from the entrance and exit of the cave are also spectacular, offering panoramic views of Ha Long Bay. We visited in the morning to avoid the crowds, which made for a more serene experience.

Overall, Sung Sot Cave is a must-visit if you’re in Ha Long Bay. The combination of natural beauty and geological wonder makes it an unforgettable experience. Highly recommend!

Feel free to adjust the details or personalize the review based on your experience!

This impressive cave is located in a beautiful horseshoe bay and is recognized as being the largest cave in the Halong Bay area. Access to the cave entrance is by way of a properly constructed stairway, with a couple of viewing platforms on the ascent. These platforms provide fantastic views out over the surrounding bay and also provide a respite for anyone wanting to take a breather on the ascent to the cave. As with the other cave sites in the area, this one has a properly constructed trail, with steps and handrails, for a safe sightseeing experience. The main feature of the cave is a massive main chamber which, from the back end, provides views back to the light streaming in from the entrance. This is an excellent sightseeing experience, and well worth the effort of getting there.

Safe travels,

Mega.

I took a 3-hour cruise through Halong Bay.  We stopped at one of the caves. The views were breathtaking.  The water appeared to be emerald green and clear.  The cave area was well taken care of.  There are a total of 600 steps to climb up and down for the cave visit.  Honestly, once I left the last viewing point, climbing down was the hardest part to me.  I enjoyed my day and highly recommend this experience.

We're been there on Friday with a tour Halong Bay to Sung Sot cave and some caves nearby. You can try some more activities as in photos i attached. The weather  was rainy and sunny too^^ so you need to bring umbrella or buy a raincoat in the boat  30.000VND ^^ (around 1.2€). Inside the cave was quite nice and even they offer to take a photo and give you keyring free (every person on photo will get one keyring free) just less than 4€ (100.000VND ) if you want a 10x20 photo with a frame. Quite short cave so one day is enough.but if you want, you can buy tour with one night sleep on boat and enjoy the fresh air.

reviews.text: Our two night cruise was exceptional! Mrs. Huong went above and beyond when we needed to change our booking dates, showing kindness and integrity. The staff was welcoming from the moment we arrived and their warmth continued throughout the trip. The boat is beautiful and our room well appointed, with oversized picture windows and a spacious balcony. The food was elegantly presented and also delicious. The off boat activities were quite memorable and always organized well. I highly recommend Heritage for your Ha Long Bay getaway.

Luxury meets nature in Halong Bay! My recent 2 day cruise was a dream. The cabins were spacious with stunning views, the dining was gourmet, and the activities, like kayaking, were unforgettable. Impeccable service made it even more special. A must-do for luxury travelers!

I love the room design so classy luxury and the bathtub experience with Halong Bay view was amazing moment in my life. The food is authentic Vietnamese combine with western food (good balance) and the staffs were doing great jobs and helpful.

For the activities they provided, I enjoyed Kayaking and went to a small island. Great experienced. Little tips that better to do it during April or May because of good weather. I did it in 1st April to 2nd April.

This amazing experienced at the cruise and beautiful view in Halong Bay will be unforgettable in my life.

Perhaps one of our best bay cruise experiences!

1. Rooms are of a good size and a nice balcony as well.
2. Food selection for meals were good and sufficient.
3. Activities were nice as we got to different places to kayak, swim and the speedboat ride was alot of fun.
4. Service…A big big shoutout to the crew and following team members who made Ha Long Bay a trip to remember.

Special thank you to Xenia, Mae, Vince, Nam, Chef Thoy, Hang and Karen.

Overall great experience with a few critiques. We did the 2 day 1 night.
We were upgraded twice from our original room and ultimately ended up in the captains quarters room. The room is the best part of the cruise, without a doubt. The full floor to ceiling window and sliding door to your private balcony  is breathtaking. Bathtub with a sea view was also mesmerizing and a huge bonus. Waking up with that view  is worth the price of admission (which is not cheap we paid $500 for our 2 day 1 night stay).

Having said this, for the price tag there are a couple points worth noting. English from the staff is almost non existent, as to be expected in Vietnam. Apart from our lovely cruise director and host who is super accommodating. The activities (kayaking, Muay Thai) were great, we really enjoyed these.

Now for the kicker. The food and drink are a bit rough. The welcome buffet was excellent. Local plates, lots of variety, fresh and I can’t speak highly enough about it. From there you kayak for a few hours and the next meal isn’t until cocktail hour which was underwhelming after such a nice lunch. Fries, some fruit, but nothing to really hold you over until dinner which is not until 7:30pm.

Dinner was…I hate to say this, rough. I would have preferred some local Vietnamese dishes and I think the chefs would do a better job with this than trying to serve “luxury” western plates.

My last comment is on the cocktails. They are undrinkable. I really expect more for drinks on a cruise of this price. Stick to wine and beer (wine is $$$ but plentiful, offering an extensive list from around the world but it comes with a cost)

Overall it was a great experience we absolutely loved it but the dinner and drinks could use some serious upgrades.

data.formatted_address: No. 01 Tuan Chau Marina, Halong Bay, Tuần Châu, Ha Long, Quảng Ninh 200000, Vietnam
data.name: Paradise Grand Cruise

reviews.text: This was one of my favorite overall travel experiences in years! I wasn’t really impressed with their hotel, which lowered my expectations of the cruise, but everything about the experience was top notch. The boat was nice, modern and very comfortable. I’m not a huge foodie, but their buffet and dinner were better than a lot of restaurants I’ve been to. Cruising around in Ha Long Bay was beautiful, but I also really enjoyed kayaking and visiting a local village. Overall fantastic company and experience.

This was a really plush cruise to Lan Ha Bay. April Le was very efficient and prompt with all our enquiries and helping to book the transfers. The cruise itself was excellent from pickup to checkout …. They have their own terminal at Tuan Chau Island and transfer you in style and comfort. The staff are excellent and the ship is new and luxurious. The only issue we had is the cruise seemed over subscribed as there was not enough room in the dining room for all the guests. We were relegated to the piano room until we complained. It a nice room but nothing like the dining room. The cruise personnel need to organise the room better to accommodate all parties. The food was plentiful and some was better than others. Cocktails are only so-so. On the whole, it’s worth the premium for the luxurious boat and the service. It really adds to the enjoyment of Lan Ha Bay.

Our 2 days 1 night trip to Lan Ha bay was simply amazing. Could not complain anything as the service, the scenery and the experience were impressive.
First off, you will be transferred to the Paradise Grand cruise by a boat. It’s not crowded at all, passengers in the first seats and luggages at the back. After 10-15 minutes you will be getting to the cruise and enjoy your welcome drinks, welcome dance, and welcome speech while your luggage was taken to your registered room.
The foods here were really good with amazingly fresh seafoods. Due to limited supplies, of course variety of buffet line will not be as high as when you’re on mainland but the dinner is what you can look forward to. Dessert was so-so, you will have wide variety of drinks including beers and wines to enjoy the night outside the seas.
Activities wise, there are kayak, boat, free swimming around Sáng Tối cave and Ao Ech area. You can do squid fishing or watching movies at night. For those who enjoys exercise, Taichi is offered in early morning when you can also watch sunrise which is a very nice experience.
Staffs are extremely nice and attentive. The reception people are just pleasant and so helpful with all your needs. Facility is new and beautiful, for sure you will have many good photos indoor.
Scenery wise, Lan Ha bay would be pretty similar to Ha Long bay as they’re connected, just belongs to different provinces. Lan Ha is less commercialized and crowded compared to Ha Long.
It’s noteworthy that there will be super limited wifi or 4G connection outside the sea so let’s forget about work and social media for a while. 2 days 1 night already covers enough of what to see and to do, also enough of disconnect to refresh, reflect and recharge yourself.
Hope you will enjoy the trip like I do.

Pick up from hotel is convenient.
The interior of the cruise is nice.
The suite room is large with wonderful view.
The staff are friendly and helpful.
I celebrated a special occasion with my partner. The arrangement is tailor-made and decoration is satisfactory. The cost is reasonable.
The quality of food on the cruise is reasonable.
Although weather is cold, there are some indoor activities like cooking class and live music.
I was lucky to catch a squid which was delicious.

Very nice experience and really good quality/price. (not for those looking for extra luxury, but exclusivity feeling for average people)

Staff were very friendly and helpful.
I would say that the one night trip is enough for sightseeing and completed with many activities.

Would recommend it to anyone looking for a cruise on Ha Long Bay.

data.formatted_address: X23X+84G, Số 9 Hạ Long, Bãi Cháy, Thành phố Hạ Long, Quảng Ninh, Vietnam
data.name: Sun World Halong Park

reviews.text: This park is super small but it has three different parks in one. I loved the cable car to go to the other park where you can view pagoda and the city views. We went when it was not busy so it was a nice experience!

Review of Sun World Halong Park

We purchased tickets to Sun World Halong Park through Agoda and arrived at the park at 2:00 PM, the opening time. However, to our great disappointment, we found out that in the rain (even a light drizzle), the rides and the water park do not operate. Our tickets were for Dragon Park, which, according to the managers, was not working. Why is it possible to buy tickets to an amusement park that is not operational?! Why mislead people by selling tickets to a park that does not function properly?

There was no one at the entrance, and we spent a long time trying to find staff. An elderly woman yelled at us in Vietnamese, which we do not understand. No one could explain to us that the park does not operate in the rain. Eventually, someone took us to the reception.

At the reception, no one could clearly explain why the rides do not operate in light rain, yet tickets are still being sold. The staff barely spoke English. No solution was offered until I suggested exchanging our tickets for any existing and working attraction or entertainment. We had to pay extra for the cable car and visit a park with only two attractions, as the ticket cost was non-refundable.

Our disappointment grew when we had to wait half an hour for the cable car, which was packed to the brim, making it impossible to enjoy the view or even breathe comfortably. The ventilation and air conditioning in the cable car were not working, adding to the discomfort. It is unclear how one cable car is supposed to serve such a large number of people in the park. We received no apologies or clear explanations as to why neither the water park nor the amusement park operates in the rain.

reviews.text: a great feeling!  My wife is a bit afraid of heights!  But this is truly the most amazing sun cycle I have ever experienced!  At this height, the view of Ha Long Bay is wonderful!  It is included in the price of the cable car at 360,000 VND/adult!
To view the complete Hanoi you need to ride this giant wheel ... Vast landscape to the vast ocean... Beautiful and mesmerizing view from top of the flyer

I recently visited Halong Solar Cycle, and it was a good experience! The price for a roundtrip tram to the park was quite reasonable, making it accessible for families and tourists. The park had a wide range of attractions to offer, from a thrilling roller coaster to a giant Ferris wheel that provided amazing panoramic views of Halong Bay and the city.

One of the highlights of the park was the Japanese-style ponds with koi, which added a touch of serenity to the overall ambiance. There was also an arcade for the kids, ensuring that everyone in the family could find something to enjoy.

What truly set Halong Solar Cycle apart was the amazing views from the Ferris wheel, providing breathtaking panoramas of Halong Bay and the city. These scenic vistas added a unique charm to the visit.

In addition to the beautiful scenery, the park offered specialty rides, including those inspired by Star Wars, which were unique and immersive experiences that delighted fans of the franchise.

Overall, I spent a few hours here, and it was time well-spent. The combination of affordability, a diverse range of attractions, and the stunning views of Halong Bay made it a memorable visit. I highly recommend Halong Solar Cycle for a fun day out in this beautiful region.

data.formatted_address: WXCR+X4C, Ngọc Châu, Tuần Châu, Thành phố Hạ Long, Quảng Ninh 200000, Vietnam
data.name: Halong Bay Vietnam

reviews.text: Awesome.. nature at its best.. day trip from Hanoi.. large deposit of limestone mountains.. various option of cruises are available which can be pre booked or booked at site..I would recommend a pre booking and do carry a good camera as you will get many opportunities for amazing clicks..
It’s like walking into a fairytale land. They call it land of the descending dragon. A good camera, a clear sky (sunny day) and a nice cruise ship are all you need to be amazed here.

Said to have been over 1000m millions of years ago and now halong bay’s rock formation is an effect of erosion. Very calm and emerald sea, we were lucky to meet with clear blue skies. A must visit to when in Hanoi

Halong Bay is a must visit place if you visit north Vietnam. Halong Bay can be reached with around two hours drive from Hanoi. You can add Halong Bay into your Hanoi itinerary. The daytour or overnight boat tour to Halong Bay can be purchased online or from local tour agent.

The famous Halong Bay is daytour which starts from morning in Hanoi Old Quarter and ends in the evening. The tour operator normally provides pick up and drop off to and from the hotel in Hanoi Old Quarter. The daytour comes with English or Vietnamese speaking guide. The Halong Bay trip will start in the midday from Ha Long City Marina with lunch at the boat. The tour will have three stops: Suprise Cove, Lan Ha Bay, and Ti Top island. The boat cruise will end with afternoon tea and enjoying sunset on the way back to Ha Long City Marina. Food served at the boat is delicious.

I suggest you order or upgrade your lunch to buffet lunch. The buffet spread is good. Some fresh seafood: prawn and shells are served with soup, bread, rice and some Vietnamese dishes. The beverages must be ordered separately with additional costs. Due to government regulations, no plastic bottle are allowed to be carried onboard and at all Halong Bay area. On the other hand, beverages at can are served.
Best experience in Vietnam ever. Ferry ride was peaceful. Meals onboard is superb! Friendly tour guide. The cave walk is another great experience.

data.formatted_address: Ti Top Beach
data.name: Ti Top Beach

reviews.text:
What an amazing place!! Words cannot express the beauty.
We came here on a cruise boat.
We decided not to go in the water for a swim as the stop was for only 45 mins, instead we climbed up halfway for the view which was breathtaking. We thoroughly enjoyed our experience as a family.   The cruise was well worth it.

Another popular tourist destination where many tour agencies will drop their customers here. The beach was super crowded during the time I was there. There were shops selling food and drinks as well. The island which I knew from my guide was named after a Russian as a result of diplomacy.

Ti Top beach is a popular destination for tourists who visit Ha Long Bay on a cruise. The beach is located on a small island named after the Soviet cosmonaut Gherman Titov, who visited it in 1962. The beach has white sand and clear water, and offers a panoramic view of the bay from the top of a hill.

However, if you are looking for a quiet and relaxing experience, you might want to avoid this beach. It is very crowded and noisy, especially during peak season. Every cruise ship stops here, so you will have to share the beach with hundreds of other visitors. There is not much space to swim or sunbathe, and you will have to pay extra for showers, lockers, chairs, and drinks. The beach is also littered with trash and plastic bottles, which spoils the natural beauty of the place.

We did not enjoy our visit to Ti Top beach. We decided to skip the beach and go for a hike instead, but it was not much better. The trail was steep and slippery, and there were so many people that it felt like a traffic jam. We had to wait in line to take pictures at the viewpoint, and we could barely see the bay because of the smog. We were disappointed by the lack of cleanliness and tranquility at this beach.

Ti Top beach is a tourist trap that does not live up to its reputation. If you want to see the true beauty of Ha Long Bay, you should look for other options that are less crowded and more eco-friendly. Ti Top beach is not worth your time or money.

When I was here, the weather was cloudy making it ideal to swim without getting too hot.
The water was warm and comfortable for swimming
They enclosed the swimming area so a small portion only.
It was a nice busy place with both locals and tourists.
Beware that the locals here might openly film you with their phones if you choose to wear a bikini or a revealing swimsuit and if you are a foreigner

It is a very beautiful beach but it is very overcrowded. Every cruise ship stops here, so if you are looking for true natural beauty, this is not the place to go. However, the water was nice to swim in since it was so hot outside and there were a lot of beautiful shells on the sea floor.

data.formatted_address: Nhà ga - Cảng tàu khách quốc tế, Hạ Long, Bãi Cháy, Thành phố Hạ Long, Quảng Ninh 200000, Vietnam
data.name: Ambassador Cruise

reviews.text: Wonderful. Five stars and more all the way. From email communication from the U.K. to the actual trip,  the service has been superb. Helpful, friendly and so efficient.  The ship itself is immaculate, the quality of the buffet exceptional,and above all the scenery and itinerary was first class. Special tribute to the pianist and the vocalist with the voice of an angel. Fittingly our cruise was on New Years Day. What an amazing once in a lifetime opportunity to start a New Year on a high!

Food at the ship was good. They have a wide selection of food and for our dinner, we had option to choose our second main course. We ordered cocktails at night and the mix was nice. Generous portion of alcohol. Water for dinner/lunch could be better if it is served. Drip coffee was awesome.

Service
Service of staff was good. It helps that there are Filipino crew which could understand English well. The crew is very helpful and nice.

Activities
I only did the first day activity which was to visit the village. The experience was refreshing.

I did one and a half hour massage and my therapist was Jessica. She was good and strong.

Room
Room was spacious and clean. Having a mirror inside the room helps. The only mirror that had was inside the toilet. Balcony space was good. Enough to relax and unwind. Drainage of shower is not draining fast enough. We had enough hangers which we like.

Suggestion
Oil selection for the massage- prefer to have a few option. The toilet has a smell. I think the smell is from the drainage in the shower. Not sure what can be done but hopefully there is a way to reduce or better yet, eliminate the odour.

I recently went on a trip with this boat and had a fantastic experience. The quality of the boat and room service was top-notch. The staff were friendly, professional, and quick to meet all my needs.

I want to give a big shoutout to Hanna, who took amazing care of me when I got seasick. She was incredibly kind and attentive, making sure I was comfortable and feeling better. Hanna's dedication and genuine concern for the passengers truly made my trip better.

I highly recommend Ambassador Cruise if you are searching for a luxury cruise on Ha Long Bay.
We booked a one night, two days cruise. The day prior our departure, I received a mail announcing that we were upgraded to the presidential suite. I must admit it was the first  time that I was upgraded (I mean a real upgrade). Apart from the room that was obviously stunning,  the meals were great too,  specially the dinner. The staff was lovely and our daughter was treated as a little princess (by the way, she sends love to Mia 🩷).
We loved the excursions except maybe for the island excursion were you could see (and smell) the boats oil where we were swimming (and you can't go further as it's a closed area). But swimming in Ha Long Bay was anyway a nice experience.
Although it's a big boat regarding to Ha Long Bay standards, we had a relaxing and great cruise. Thank you to all the staff members 🙏🏻.

Great 3 days/2 nights experience! Although the schedule feels packed, it’s all optional so you can chill at the boat or do the excursions. The food is what makes this trip memorable, definitely worth the price! Shout out to Harrison for taking care of us all throughout our stay. All the staff were helpful and nice, the service is topnotch! We explored a bit of Cat Ba island on our 2nd day, so if you got time booked the 3 days instead of overnight cruise.

reviews.text: Peaceful place, I'm so grateful can reach this place. You have to climb the mountain if you want to see best view of Ha Long Bay. I think that place never make regret

The first time I visited here by the boat with day trip. It was not interesting for me because so dirty, so much trash and people sell souvenir stuffs around.
When I see they offer helicopters and seaplanes to enjoy the bay from above, I decided to give a try and I love it. The view is incredible! The trip also show me a part of that city too, so beautiful. Total flying time will be roundly 30 minutes.

Beautiful destination!
It’s worth it to take a cruise tour to observe such a beauty. It has become one of the 7 natural wonders in the world. Must see if you visit Vietnam.
Take a cruise and just enjoy the stunning views with a glass of wine🥂

Hạ Long Bay is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a popular travel destination in Vietnam. The name means “descending dragon” in Vietnamese.

The bay features thousands of limestone karsts and islets in various shapes and sizes.

It has a rich biodiversity and a long history of human settlement. Hạ Long Bay is a natural wonder that attracts millions of visitors every year.

data.formatted_address: Bai Tu Long Bay, Quảng Ninh, Vietnam
data.name: Bai Tu Long Bay

reviews.text: Bai Tu Long is a beautiful area protected by hundreds of islands. The scenery is tranquil and out of this world. I have never seen anything quite like it. I highly recommend a longer 3-day - 2-night cruise to escape the massive crowds within Halong Bay.

Less tourisy than Halong Bay. If you want to get away from the busy and hustle Halong bay, this is area to come. Hundreds of islands here that has no one around and very few boats. Limestone islands shooting up from the calm Emeral color ocean, whether it’s day or night, the beauty of this area is spectacular.

Bai Tu Long Bay is a coastal bay located in Quang Ninh Province, Vietnam. It consists of hundreds of small and large islands and is situated within the Gulf of Tonkin, in the northeastern region of Vietnam. Bai Tu Long Bay encompasses a sea area belonging to the cities of Halong and Cam Pha, as well as Van Don island district. The bay is bordered by Halong Bay to the southwest, Cam Pha city to the west, the sea to the east, and Co To island district to the northeast.

The history of Bai Tu Long Bay is closely intertwined with the heroic chronicles of the Vietnamese people. It is associated with the place name Van Don, a bustling seaport since the time of the Ly dynasty. Nearly 900 years ago, it was a lively trading hub attracting merchants from Champa, China, Japan, India, and other places for exchanging goods.

Bai Tu Long Bay is also a place to commemorate the glorious achievements of General Tran Khanh Du and the three Pham brothers (from Quan Lan village), who defeated the fleet of the Yuan Mongol invader Truong Van Ho in 1288.
In addition, there is the Cua Ong Temple (also known as Suot Temple) located on the bay, dedicated to Hung Nhuong Vuong Tran Quoc Tang, the third son of the revered Hung Dao Vuong Tran Quoc Tuan.

Bai Tu Long Bay is part of the famous Halong Bay. It is located northeast of Vietnam, at 165 km from the capital Hanoi. The bay comprises approximately 1,600 islands and islets, which forms a remarkable panorama of limestone pillars. Most of the islands are uninhabited. The site’s outstanding scenic beauty, the area is rich with geological magnificence.

I suggest everyone not to let local travel agents confuse you about Halong Bay vs Bai Tu Long Bay. They are both part of Bai Tu Long National Park and both part of the pristine Heritage, both bays stand right next to each other and they shared outstanding beauty. Bai Tu Long Bay occupies ¾ of Ha Long Bay.

The natural views were magnificent, I loved every minute of it, going from island to island, and enjoying nature! Loved it; we were even allowed to go ashore for a little while to enjoy swimming and relaxing in a small but beautiful beach.

In the evening, i truly enjoyed a stunning sunset.

Beautiful bay, very quiet compared to Ha Long Bay and just as scenic, although the small beaches were somewhat dirty, so we couldn't get a good swim until we got to the day boat, after kayaking. We visited it the second day of our 3 days and 2 nights cruise to Ha Long Bay. We only saw two other day boats along or nearby, which made the experience very relaxed. The kayaking was a bit harder than the first day in the fishing village, due to the waves and more open waters, but had some incredible views.

data.name: Lan Ha Bay

reviews.text: Must visit! Amazing natural space definitely needed to be seen when coming to the north of Vietnam. Unfortunately the level of rubbish in the water is pretty shocking and I definitely thought that we treat ourselves with a very big cruise which is the end is one of the few options available to visit the sea. If you can avoid an old-style

It’s definitely a must see and the view over the bay on our beautiful luxury ship was a real treat- BUT I was shocked about the rubbish floating around and the murky water. Why is nobody taking care of the so promoted unesco world heritage nature wonder??? Please do something about it. Would NEVER swim in it. Kayaking was nice but I worried to get sick just by touching the waters. Shame
Highly recommended for 1 night stay on cruise. Quite even though there are lots of other cruise ships parked nearby.
The scenery is really beautiful. However there is a lot of rubbish floating around

Lan Ha Bay is located in the Gulf of Tonkin in the northeastern part of Vietnam. It is a geological extension of Halong Bay and is home to around 300 karst islands and limestone sea rocks. The bay is known for its stunning natural beauty and is home to a unique ecosystem with several species of endangered marine life.
Lan Ha Bay is smaller than Halong Bay, but it is less visited and less inhabited, making it a more peaceful and serene destination. Visitors can enjoy kayaking and biking, and there are many eco-friendly accommodations available in the area. You'll love this place.

data.formatted_address: Trân Châu, Cát Hải, Hai Phong, Vietnam
data.name: Hospital Cave

reviews.text:
This stop was better than I expected, if you're in the area I'd definitely recommend checking out this hospital cave. It was way bigger than I imagined and gives you an idea of life during these times. Its oddly wet inside and has a weird smell, mannequins were quite creepy. We walked through it in probably 15 minutes tops.
The giant cave used to be a cinema for them fun fact, and there was a swimming pool in there as well

This site was the last stop on my tour of Cat Ba Island and, as it turned out, was probably the most interesting. More a bunker than a cave, the internal areas are completely concreted and was used as a safe haven for wounded military personnel, during the war years. Its construction is definitely a bomb proof bunker. There’s a triple door entrance, with heavy steel doors, to access the internal room areas. The rooms are basically hospital treatment facilities, with mannequins in place to give a feel for the historical aspect. A tour through the hospital cave will take approximately 30 – 40 minutes.

Safe travels,

Mega.

Not worth the 40k price. This should be much less or free or included with the 80k for the other cave and national park entrance. There's no information about the hospital and it's significance. The rooms are very plain and boring. No effect was put in to how it actually looked and felt back then. Just some tables, beds and dummies laid around in each room. The caves up the road are much more interesting.

When we arrived there was an English guide who took us through. Extremely informative, as there are not signs spelling out the uses of the rooms I highly recommend a guide. Impressively preserved rooms with pictures and figures helping understand what the space must have been like during the American War. A must see while visiting Cat Ba, especially for any Americans.

This was a really interesting stop and for 40kVND each I would recommend to anyone passing by! There isn’t a whole lot inside the cave but there are some models and furniture to give you an idea of what it was like. There was a guide at the door before you go in to tell you a bit about the cave and then you were free to walk around. The 3rd floor was unfortunately closed when we were there due to flooding but the other 2 floors were still accessible and housed the main hospital. There are a few flights of stairs to get in and out of the cave so bear this in mind when visiting. These can be slippery when wet. We parked across the road from the ticket office at a cafe.

data.name: Vung Vieng Fishing Village

reviews.text: The visit of the village was included in our cruise, through a 45min boat trip across the village. It’s beautiful, and fascinating to see these households floating on water, and people living there all year round. We also visited the pearl farm at the entrance of the village, and I recommend listing and watching the explanations on how pearls are made.

Sea kayaking through this tiny floating fishing village is truly special. The village only have less than 20 floating houses. 2014 was relocated to mainland by government, but they can’t make living in the city some of them move back to the water. There is eve a cute restaurant with food and painting to sale. The entire village was protected by the islands around them. Makes it idea to live. The water is calm even in the typhoon season.

Vung Vieng Fishing Village wasn't just a stop on my cruise - it became the highlight of the entire trip.  This hidden gem nestled in Bai Tu Long Bay offered a complete contrast to the usual tourist bustle. Here, life slows down to the gentle rhythm of lapping waves.

Floating on the turquoise water, the village is a cluster of colorful houses inhabited by generations of fishermen. Witnessing their way of life, so connected to the sea, was a truly serene experience.  If you're looking to escape the crowds and experience the authentic charm of Halong Bay,  Vung Vieng Village is a must-visit.  Highly recommended!

Came to this amazing place as part of our cruise 🚢. This place is very beautiful and it was amazing to see how this village functions. Also saw some pearls farm and were explained about types of it and how it’s surced.
In the end you can also but some jewelry with pearls, which were amazing! They do accept credit cards 💳 .

Great place to visit, highly recommended!
Vung Vieng is a serene glimpse into the past. While it is a tourist destination - the fish, pearls, and watching the locals work on their floating homes is a sight to see.

There are two night markets in Halong Bay! Though not massive, both offer a variety of goods Ha Long Bay Night Market and Halong Night Marke these markets open at 6 pm and 7 pm, respectively.

Both with similar items on sale, they're perfect for an evening walk and shopping spree. From local crafts to souvenirs, and we even found the"branded" shirts, there's something for everyone. Plan to spend your night here and soak in the bustling ambiance of Halong Bay! 🌟🛍️🌌

Not Recommended. It's 7:30 pm, 10k parking fee. Only us and a handful of tourists were walking in this night market. Finish walking the whole place in 3 minutes. reviews.text: Amazing tour! We luckily came across this tour while searching for the best advice for a tour on Trip Advisor while at dock on a cruise ship in Halong Bay. It took us off the beaten path of every other cruise tour, 1000s of people going there at the same time. We sailed nice and slow through the islands to our own private one which included a cave, kayaking and the most amazing seafood lunch. I highly recommend it, the tour was 5 star and only 22 of us onboard. I believe it can take 35 people. The views were amazing too, so glad we went. We booked through Ms Gam on Whatsapp Ms Gam Private Tours +84 35 240 3168. She can find you any type of tour you like and you can pay her when you meet her at port in US or Dong. We paid in Dong. I’m sure can book direct through La Muse site too.
Ha Long Bay, Vietnam  is beautiful!

reviews.text: 🤩 I want to thank all crew members for doing amazing job with special care. The service is fantastic 🤗 the main manager doing all what he can to make this time the best in Your life. He also wants to know You a little and explain everything. This is how tourism should work. The amount of food was unbelievable 😃 but also good quality and made with care. Waitress ware carrying one plate after another, never stop 😅 the quality for the room I would grade with 4 stars, not perfect but nice with bath and view. The attraction like kayaking and visiting cave are full of other tourists so get ready for that mentaly. Unfortunately, you can see the garbage floating, especially after sunset, we could see a river of garbage 🤬😤😭 I don't know who was responsible for that. To the Pegasus company - please fight with it, this killing animals and our beautiful planet.

Although manager Dan did an excellent job you feel like a sardine in a can on the tour. All the cruise ships go one after the other to the same place, the same on a boat trip to a cave or a kayak. A local seller on a boat comes up to your room window on the ship. I had no freedom there.
On top of that, the Pegasus employee in the harbour office proved to be untrustworthy. The prices in the port and on the ship are very high (you only get 350ml of water, a sachet of instant coffee and a sachet of tea) - better do your water and drinks shopping in Ha Long town beforehand (the food on the ship was very good).
To sum up:
The tour is not worth the price (210USD/pp). Better to hire a private boat with a captain for the day. Avoid organised tours.
Absolutly terrible! The rooms were small and dirty, the food was bad and the Staff didnt speek english 😱Tehno music 6.30 in the morning. The surrounding are beautiful though
Nice experience

We left Da Nang/Hoi An to experience beautiful Ha Long Bay.
This turned out to be a nightmare! Small dirty rooms, dirty water, Only one in 15 could speak any other Vietnamese.

The view is the only good thing about this trip.

The food tasted terrible.. My boyfriend is allergic to seafood, but was constantly recommended seafood.

Made me want to cry, and pay a lot more to just get us back, but stuck on this horrible boat.

Hope I save someone else from experiencing the same thing we did 🙏

Our executive deluxe rooms with balcony was changed at the last minute with a vague excuse and a minor discount was offered along with free transport. we realised that this was a regular occurance as other friends had the same change in prebooked package with another vague excuse.
Our new rooms were junior suites.. On the lowest level of the cruise ship, nxt to the noisy engine room, my room was very very small with no cupboards, no room to even open our suitcases which had to be kept on the bed to open, bathroom was always wet as there was no separate stall for bath, in the night a large cockroach was in the room. The only saving grace of the room was large glass windows which gave us a good veiw.
Food was well presented, but taste was hit and miss, not even an extra piece of bread was given when asked. Room had only 2 small bottles of water which was not bottled and was not replenished the nxt day.
Cruise guide was very impatient and a bit hard to understand.
Will not recommend to anybody, As they were not value for money at all. Felt cheated as our cruise ship, and spot we had selected to visit  after lots of prior research was arbitrarily changed at the last minute the evng before we were to board the ship.

Two days one night  on Amanda cruise  ship. Absolutely  fantastic,  food outstanding,  cabins beautiful,  and all of the staff so welcoming,  couldn't  do enough  for you. Entertainment  was excellent.
Not so much a cruise as a put put into the bay and drop anchor. small boat trip to see the monkeys and karaoke on board was fun. Cabin was nice.

data.formatted_address: 54MF+F77, Kỳ Thượng, Thành phố Hạ Long, Quảng Ninh, Vietnam
data.name: Nature reserve Dong Son - Ky Thuong

reviews.text:
The road to the reserve is a winding mountain pass like an action movie. Standing from above, looking down at the scenery is very majestic, especially in the early morning when fog covers the mountains and hills, people can feel the atmosphere. cold and freshness here.

The reserve is inhabited by ethnic people and has beautiful and cool clear blue water streams. The air is very fresh, taking a wedding photo set here is not too bad, everyone.
Spending the night here is a very interesting and also very... dangerous thing.

Many wild animals still exist, and especially poisonous insects.
Besides, the animals and plants here are also very rich.

Suitable for those who love experiences and nature. Beautiful space, as far as the eye can see. Majestic scenery. However, the way up is a bit difficult, the bends have sliding sand which is dangerous. Note that when going to this place, you need to prepare food and drinks in advance
The road up is quite steep and dangerous, a suitable place to explore nature
Worth experiencing
The fresh air is worth experiencing

data.formatted_address: International Port, Pier 20B, Thành phố Hạ Long, Quảng Ninh 200000, Vietnam
data.name: Capella Cruise

reviews.text:
Room (5/5)
Food (3/5)
Activity (5/5)
Price ($440/room/night)

I took the two days cruise.
The staff was great and the experience was great.

We wait at the waiting facility at ha long bay and go to capella cruise using small boat at 11:45 AM.

You need to try at least once experiencing the beauty of ha long bay

An absolutely great experience! This was my first time stayed a night on cruise and especially on Xmas eve. The cruise members welcomed us with their smile and kind service all the time. The cruise is quite new and fully equipped all kinds of facility. There were a lot of activities to join, such as kayaking, water sliding, learning how to make spring rolls, evening party, cave visiting. Highly recommend to everyone who wants to enjoy a chill time in beautiful Ha Long Bay.

What an incredible experience. The ship was the most luxurious boat I’ve stayed on, the staterooms were a great size, all with balconies and spa baths with views and the infinity pool and slide a real highlight.  The itinerary and activities were great and the food exceptional 🙌🏻

Highly recommend

Amazing experience. The ship was so nice and very clean and the staff was super friendly. One thing to note with all of these ha long cruises no matter which you choose is that there isn’t much cruising on the actual ship. There are tender boats and speed boats that help with transport to the activity locations. The ship is permitted to anchor in the same sleep spot each night. This is nothing that Capella can change but how they all operate.

We had an amazing 1 night cruise with capella. The boat is absolutely beautiful and luxurious. The staff is so sweet and kind, especially tom, gin and jojo are always fun and entertaining. The food was like in a michelin star restaurant, the cook did an amazing job at the 5 course menu!!!! The activities are also fun. Highly recommend this cruise thank you for everything

data.formatted_address: Vạn Xuân, P. Bạch Đằng, Thành phố Hạ Long, Quảng Ninh, Vietnam
data.name: Ha Long Market

reviews.text: This market sits at the center of the city right off the new port that is being built. It’s a very colourful place, filled with interesting stalls and people. The products are numerous but the visuals are exotic to absurd. The fish and meat market are hard on the eyes if you’re an animal lover but you try and look past it; not all cultures treat animals the same, but it’s worth a visit. We met some fisherwomen who took us out to the bay to see the limestone islands up close, that in itself was amazing.
Products range from Nike shoes to women's underwear to men's  jackets to a fabulous supply of fabrics for sewing. Fish and fresh fruit and veg if staying a while. Real Asian market.

Ha Long market is really amazing place that you need to visit when you come to Ha Long. You can buy coffee and tea with very nice price, many kinds of fresh fruit, flowers, fresh vegetable, food and street food. The most favorite food I would recommend is Cha Muc Ha Long (squid cake). The seafood market is not really market but like a zoo, I mean so so amazing with many kinds of seafood they all alive and swimming inside pots
Crazy and wonderfull if you like to be in the Middle of thight salestand where people talk loud and try to move fast. Expirience it is and á food story to tell when you go back home.
Must-come location to take some photos for city tour 😂

data.formatted_address: 433 Lê Lợi, Trần Hưng Đạo, Thành phố Hạ Long, Quảng Ninh, Vietnam
data.name: Ha Long 2 Market

reviews.text: Lots of ingredients for your next meal, reasonable priced cloths and lots of daily stuff can be found here. Tho hygiene is not really good here so prepare to clean some stain.
So many more...foods. It's great!
there are two different buildings selling all kinds of accessories, clothes, luggage and on the other side mainly vegetables and meat stalls.

An kaleidoscope of colours and variety. Huge Salmon, Tuna and variety of fish and produce, make sure you don't wear flip flops and got your Google maps tuned in. The natural aromas can be overpowering by the river and it's easy to get lost in throng.

If you want to see "Vietnam Market" this is the place, live seafood and interesting fruits.
Good place to look at as a tourist.

data.name: Bãi Cháy Market

reviews.text: Marketplace for locals. Expect to see the local butchers killing their geese in plain vieuw and preparing their meats in the open air. Try it out when you want to want to get a feel of the local culture in an otherwise over touristical town.
Local market. Nothing special to find here. Not the kind of tourist market or presentable market. Really is for the locals.
Just like other local markets. But tourists can search here for abit cheaper to compare with shops surrounding

This is the local market in this area. Mostly clothes and other summer wear items. But also a section dedicated to food. Some stalls have electronics. (Mostly all replica products)

Workers here are fairly good, not too in your face.

Worth a visit, but nothing really selcisl

Great local 'shopping mall'. When we've visited we didn't see a single tourist. No hassle to buy anything. Friendly and helpful people if you ask about sizes. I also recommend waking trough the food market.

reviews.text: Don buy here. Chop sticks with shell holders and weighted ends. 450,000/550,000 dong vs 50,000 at regular markets. Even after haggling for 10 minutes. Walk away. Go to Sữa Chua Trân Châu Hạ Long - Quảng Ninh Cơ Sở 99 next to bimmart instead. Very fair honest and kind owners.

Nice infrastructure but basically empty and stall holders were not even there. Dead ghost town. No idea why - either it’s Low season or covid killed things for them. It’s unfortunate as the space was built for huge traffic

Look like this place is sort of designated for tourist. As the date of visit on 12 July 2022, most of the shops are not opened. Look like it will take some time for the shops to re-open from the tourism recovery.
From the look, the night market was created from a carpark.
Various of shoplots. Good place to buy souvenirs, but no price stated so have to bargain yourself.

data.formatted_address: Lô h30-h33 Peninsula/2, Hùng Thắng, Thành phố Hạ Long, Quảng Ninh, Vietnam
data.name: A La Carte Ha Long Bay Hotel

reviews.text:
The room was lovely and clean, it could’ve had a bigger balcony and then it would have been perfect.

The roof top pool is amazing and the best feature of this hotel, although if you are in the residential part, you will have to pay to use this!

The room service was quick but the food was not 5 star at all, more like 2 star.

Reception was lovely and helpful.

Gym was very good considering it is a hotel gym. But agin you have to pay to use this.

Overall a good stay just hidden extras and you have to grab to the town as it is not in walking distance.

We wanted to drop off our luggage in the lobby today after a 10-hour bus ride until we could check into our room (we still had to wait more than 5 hours) so we wouldn't have to carry our backpacks around. The lady at the reception was very unfriendly and said, "their lobby is too small" and we have to take our luggage with us. I have rarely encountered someone so unaccommodating; I was very disappointed. I absolutely cannot recommend this place; we left immediately because we didn't want to spend a night here.

Incredible rooms and facilities! Everything was so new and clean, I really felt as though I was living in luxury.
Unfortunately the location is very strange- consistent with other reviews, I would recommend visiting when construction of the area is complete unless you’re happy staying in the hotel the entire time. The beach and the streets are also pretty dirty. I did have a fantastic experience at the spa, it was fairly pricey but absolutely worth it.

ATTENTION -> Don’t stay in this hotel its not a 5 star hotel not even a 3 star. THE WORST EXPERIENCE EVER!
No hospitality or guest friendliness, our room curtains did not close so we had 3 people in the room until 00:30 am! For working!, no other room was provided and no money or other service to excuse was given, not even a sorry. We had no sleep…
-The hotel name is a la carte, but in the restaurant was not even possible to order „a la carte“ just buffet, thats a big freaking joke.
-The surroundings is a construction side, loud and ugly not as on the pictures, all fake.

The rooms were very nice and the restaurant and cafe had very good food and drinks. There was also a small supermarket that was very convenient. I felt like the service of the staff really depended on the person. Some staff members were excellent and provided excellent service but others had a bad attitude or made many simple mistakes.

Also, the area is still under construction so the view is not so great. The outside of the building looks nothing like the photos.

I would recommend staying here after all of the construction is finished.

data.formatted_address: WXCR+X4C, Ngọc Châu, Tuần Châu, Thành phố Hạ Long, Quảng Ninh, Vietnam
data.name: Halong Bay Cruise

reviews.text:
A well designed and curated overnight cruise, food, room bathroom was alright. Outside activities were bit chaotic perhaps due to the rush season. On board activities were not worth the mention, specially the loud karaoke and huge speakers were really annoying both interms of enjoying and very disturbing for others like us who were enjoying the atmosphere and conversation amongst us and there were no considerations for that at all.
Otherwise the cruise is certainly worth taking.

Great cruise with great food. Staff very friendly and helpful. Caves were busy as expected. Kayaking was good fun. We had a 3day/2 night cruise. The one night cruise seemed a bit rushed for the others. Definitely worth the 2 nights.

Biggest problem of the cruise is waiting on other passengers who are late for activities. Normally one or two who make the other 40 passengers wait on them.

Starting from the harbor, extremely rood woman. The boat it’s old, smell of humidity in the room, rooms not perfect clean. The food very low quality. The staff of on the boat was kind. I will never again take this boat. Not very nice experience.

DON'T get a MASSAGE here.
Terrible service. Booked in for a 2 hours massage. The lady didn't know how to do it. Kept tapping/hitting hard with the sides of her hands. No massage techniques such as effleurage were used. The air-conditioning were blasting from two directions. I asked for a blanket. She threw a blanket which was folded still onto me and left it like that. Spoke no English and had a bad attitude. Half way through the massage she stopped and said it was her boyfriends birthday and she has to leave 1 hour early and hopes that I can sympathise (google translate). Only completed less than an hour of a two hour massage while still on the clock. Then lied to management the next day after I complained saying that she only had space for one hour as she had someone booked it after me. Terrible service. Don't go here !

Absolutely unhappy! After spending huge amount, do not like to be in NCC Camp!! Neither good manners nor respectfully serving by staff. All kind of restrictions with no TV, no internet, no good jacuzzi and above all totally unfriendly and rude staff. Definitely not recommended, if you have better options.

data.formatted_address: Hàng Nồi, P, Thành phố Hạ Long, Quảng Ninh, Vietnam
data.name: Poem Mountain

reviews.text: We went today. Found the ladys house that you have to go through to get to the mountain. Went up some very steep stairs to find a man sleeping in a house in very poor state then a small dog barking. The unkept lady came out and showed us a 500k dong note. We were expecting 50k so we went back down. Another local asked if we were trying to go up the mountain and led us down a dodgey little alley. And knocked on a door we decided against going in as it felt very dodgey. This mountain is not for tourists as it stands. There just isn't an easy access point and from what I gather it's illegal and very dangerous. This comes from 2 fit males. Don't put yourself at risk, please. Just view it from the sun wheel ferris wheel nearby. That place is great and welcoming. Do the cable car and maybe theme park and water park too instead. Enjoy yourself

For Today I planned to find out about that Poem Mountain.
Ahead I found out it got closed but nobody was able to tell about the actual state.

When I arrived at the area I walked up and down using the navigation on my smartphone and checking the mountain behind the row of houses looking for access. Locals realized that and for an "access fee" about 500.000 Dong they got me through their house and helped with the steep climb to get access to the stairs.
Attention! At first: obviously illegal. At second: fit people only. No overweight, not for weak persons, not for people with vertigo, heart diseases or breath issues. Just "do not try at home". If something happen: there is no access for anyone with a stretcher. You would need an helicopter.

Half of the ascend are stairs. Quite weathered, some fell apart but towards the peak just a rocky path. No, not a cobblestone way. Boulders. Overgroving green, old leaves make it unsecure and unobvious. Cautious steps needed. Your thighs had happier situations before only and your lungs are thinking about to go somewhere else for an easier job.

Yes, the view is amazing. No wonder this place got this name. Really inspiring. If you ask me was it worth it: yes, a real adventure.
However, today we can use drones. No place you have to find to operate; you can do everywhere else (however, I have no idea about how-to operate in a legal way). They even offer individual flights over the Halong Bay area.

I had to go down soon as the sun was about to go down. At least my breath was more silent now. I missed the spot where my ascend joined the official path. Here I found the reason why it is closed. Apparently a rockslide cut off the stairs. A house high. Even if you could bribe the guard at the official entrance - He could not do anything to get you up.
So I had to turn back to find the trail I got here.

Back down I was wet from sweat, dirty and relieved.
The conclusion: even if the view is breathtaking: it is too dangerous. If something happen those helping people could get real difficuties, not just that injured person.
Use a drone - way more versatile, take the flight or that cable car. Great view, no danger and in the last case a beautiful amusement park awaits you. Ah, and that park has a real tall ferris wheel.
The mountain access need a full revamp, repair and modernisation and for the upper part stairs had to be created. Which would be a big investment. As the tip is used by a communication company: that installation is not safe for visitors Even this one has to be renewed at all.
I do not see it could be open soon at all.

A last note: as I used my time after work I had too narrow time constraints. A Saturday Morning would be perfect: still cool, the fog would disappear soon, the sun delivers great photo atmosphere and plenty of time to use.

Cool hike, amazing view. Lady is super sketchy, you have to walk halfway into her home before the dogs bark or just knock on the metal door. Use previous pics of the parking lot for reference on location. Her backyard is GNARLY. Super smelly, animals everywhere, garbage everywhere, made me feel pretty gross. The start of the hike after the ladder is a little sketchy but the rest is totally fine. I’d recommend for people in good shape or under the age of 35

As described below. Noisy dog alerts the old lady. Once youre inside she shows you the 500k note for payment (bring exact money).  It is super super steep and dangerous. It takes about 20 minutes to get up. Make sure you remember where you join the formal steps.

Blue door is located next to the Sea Store at 20°56'59"N 107°04'43"E

Definitely wear shoes as it is sharp and slippery in spots.

I didn't do this myself I just watched 😉😉😉

View 5 Star

Journey to the view point -5.

We went through the lady's blue door. We were worried the dogs would bite and it smelt so bad. She literally picked up a ladder and shoved it against a rock and said hold on and be back within the hour. This was such a dodgy climb. Literally rock climbing, if you fell there was a long way day and you certainly wouldn't want to fall into the barbed wire!! You then make it to the old official walk which at first is nice proper steps but then becomes just big rocks for you to step and climb over. It's a tough walk. Please be super careful!! I can see someone getting really hurt doing this.

Really very amazing place, must watch. A unique place to visit, the LimeStone rocks constructed by nature a million years ago. You will have to go at entry point of rock using steps and you will found amazed view under the rock, water flows there from one point to another which made the different shapes. You have to reach there by a Cruise 🛳 enjoy the way having lots of rocks, shooting of Hollywood movie 🎥 King kong was also done here. Watch the Fighting Cocks during the Cruise ride.

The Dau Go Cave is a fun place to visit. However, please be prepared for some physical walking inside the cave. Some with long stairs uphill walking. Make sure to wear a pair of comfortable shoes.

Dau Go Cave is a big cave that has lots of rocks with different shapes, and some have spotlights. It is beautiful, and I have a good exercise in there! Lol
Amazing display of nature at its best.  You'd have to get over the fact that a lot of people go there, though. There are dozens of boats in and out all day.

It's currently the largest limestone cave in Halong Bay which will surly impress you with its stunning stalactites and stalagmites. But it will kinda disappoint you with the large crowd when you visit in crowding periods or maybe holidays. Although it's worth a visit, I advise against going inside if you can't walk or climb stairs.

After exiting Thien Cung Cave, a pathway takes sightseers around the cliff face to the entrance of DAU GO CAVE. This cave tends to get less visitors, possibly because of the number of stairs to climb. The cave is bigger than Thien Cung and an excursion includes ducking under some low hanging rocks. The main feature is the large entrance room where some local artists have placed artwork around a boarded walking platform. A tour through this cave will take about 45 minutes.

data.formatted_address: 3F7Q+GX9, Hạ Long, Vân Đồn District, Quảng Ninh, Vietnam
data.name: Bai Tu Long National Park

reviews.text: Absolutely wonderful place, has to be done if visiting Vietnam. Came here for a one night cruise from Hanoi. Would review the tour, but cannot remember the name of the company. We came here instead of Ha Long, as it is a little quieter - don't be fooled mind, still a lot of boats doing the same tours. The scenery has to be seen to be believed. Stunning, a once in a lifetime experience. Visited the caves, and went kayaking as well. Only downside was that we couldn't go for a swim. Apparently the government have stopped this, something to do with jellyfish. Not convinced, more likely to do with the amount of pollution in the sea, caused by the sheer number of boats. Don't let this put you off though, it's amazing.

Bai Tu Long National Park is located in the Bai Tu Long Bay complex, in Van Don district, Quang Ninh province, nearly 200km east of Hanoi.
Bai Tu Long National Park includes a marine ecosystem with the sea surface accounting for 2/3 of the national park area and is home to many rare plant and animal gene samples, many species recorded in the red book.
With a total area of ​​15,783 hectares, of which the area of ​​forests and forest land is 6,125 hectares with more than 40 large and small islands and 9,650 hectares of sea surface, lagoons, and flooded tidal flats. In which Ba Mun island ecological area, Minh Chau commune is the core area of ​​the national park. Plant and animal species living in forest gardens and waters in the Bai Tu Long National Park area are very rich, rare, and of high value in preserving genetic resources.
Bai Tu Long National Park is not only a terrestrial biosphere reserve, but also a place to protect Vietnam's coastal biological resources.

Bai Tu Long National Park includes a marine ecosystem with the sea surface accounting for 2/3 of the national park area and is home to many rare plant and animal gene samples, many species recorded in the red book.
Bai Tu Long National Park is beautiful, with many rare and diverse species of animals and plants.

data.formatted_address: 160 Hạ Long, Bãi Cháy, Thành phố Hạ Long, Quảng Ninh 200000, Vietnam
data.name: Novotel Ha Long Bay

reviews.text: Very good hotel with a big round swimming pool that has a shallow area for kids. Staying on the top floors gives you a nice view of the water and islands. In the morning, The  breakfast buffet had local fruit, baked pastries, custom made eggs, and good Vietnamese coffee.

Do not stay in Halong Bay!!!

This hotel was actually alright, however there is a beach disco every night until the early hours and it’s very very loud.  So my recommend would be to not stay in Halong Bay at all.  Do a boat trip do not stay here overnight.

Nice hotel with great location, fab views of front square and ocean.
A special thanks to Ms. Thu at the front desk – she really went the extra mile to make sure we were well taken care of. Defenitely come back next time. Thank you!
Novotel is a beautiful hotel. Clean facilities, comfortable bed, and AC works great. Halong Bay however may not be worth your time. Day trip it from Hanoi if you can.

The hotel offers very spacious and comfortable rooms, providing a pleasant stay. However, the water pressure in the shower is notably weak, which can be a drawback for some guests.

Unfortunately, the spa was closed due to COVID, and it would have been helpful to be informed about this during the booking process.

On a similar note, the breakfast provided at the hotel is not impressive, and considering the quality and cost, it might be more worthwhile to explore dining options outside.

Despite these minor issues, the overall comfort of the rooms makes the stay enjoyable, but improvements in communication and breakfast offerings could enhance the experience.

Good for a photo and a view of the bay, but that's it. I checked it out while riding around Hạ Long
Jul 2024

data.formatted_address: H.Vụng Hà, Thành phố Hạ Long, Quảng Ninh, Vietnam
data.name: H.Vụng Hà

reviews.text:
This indeed the last remains of floating village  which indeed at present is 23 families from that of 200+.

- You would able to see the problems faced by them as well as the life around this place. Potable water is the biggest concern.

- Most of them are fisherman and currently due to tourism they took up the role of boatman/boatwoman which is better paying than fishing.

- Overall good experience to understand the life in middle of water and mountains.

Very peaceful floating fishing village situated in limestone islands. This place is sheltered from the constant motor sounds of the tour and tender boats.  Once you board a row boat, all the sound disappears and and all that can be heard is birds calling and the sound of the oars stirring the water.  The views are great and the rowers will take the boats very close to the rocks giving brief chances to see sea life.

Floating village is an eye opener. They were once uneducated until the government stepped in to support them buy offering free education and houses on land. But they didnt last on land long and moved back to the floating village. They survive on tourism and their fishing although stocks appear to be dwindling. Make sure you give them a good tip as they only get one tour per day. Yes that one boat ride is only chance they have to earn money.
Beautiful fishing village with a lot of history.  Very peaceful.
Scenic and peaceful

data.formatted_address: Vụng Tùng Sâu Vịnh, Tp. Hạ Long
data.name: Hạ Long Pearl Museum

reviews.text:
Came here as part of tour. Interesting to see the floating farm and how they have managed to culture so many pearls.
Great to learn the process of cultivating pearls. There is also kayaking to do here.
Good education on pearls with live demo sessions. This is complimentary in package to Ha long bay from Hanoi. Very expensive to buy Jewellery here with pearls. Has good washrooms and food shops.

Just an okayish stop enroute to the Halong bay cruise.... They've got quite a lot of Pearl jewelry on display. . They also do Oyester culture here.. not a great fantasized stop during your visit to the Halong bay.

Good place to visit, and shop pearls. Also a good place for Kayaking and swimming.

But careful of the employees at the pearl jewellery shop. They are very manipulative to sell more expensive items to you.
Interesting place for Ha Long visitors. It's nice to know the process of creating pearls, it's also possible to buy one.

data.formatted_address: Hà Trung, Thành phố Hạ Long, Quảng Ninh, Vietnam
data.name: FLC Ha Long Bay

reviews.text: We stayed here for a whole week and we had one of the most relaxing times. The weather, location, and view were to our liking (just wish we played some golf), kids loved the indoor swimming pool. The morning buffet was suitable for all family members (there were both Asian and Western cuisines). If you ever visit the Ha Long Bay area, I will recommend you stay here.

This place caters to rich foreign visitors from wealthier Asian countries. I met a lot of guests from Australia, New Zealand, Singapore, Japan, South Korea, Taiwan, and Malaysia.

To get in the area, you must pass the security gates. My cousin was driving his Kia car and they were looking at us because we had local plates. I met up with a friend who took us around to his room and out for lunch. It's a nice resort and golf course and there are a few others in Ha Long Bay for the rich foreign visitors to the area.

Absolutely frustrating kitchen service. It took them 1hour 15mins to serve very basic dinner. We had to call 3 times to remind them. Never experienced this with any 5 star hotel before. Look at the tray for food serving. Looks very old and dirty. They strictly prohibit to order food from outside or bring food to your room by yourself, food is ofcourse much more expensive than outside.

Im not surprised by the quality of service in such hotel. Nothing survival to say it’s what to expect and has a foreigner I think it’s nice to enjoy few night there for this price!

Very nice staff !

Well I’ve stayed here at FLC 5 times already and this time I was upset.

Rooms are clean, spacious and well equipped but the sofa was dirty and with big dirt stains on it.

The room service dinner (we ordered around 11 pm) was also good but then again the dishes were not washed well, I saw stains on plates. Fine no issues to me….

“”The breakfast; I tied to get tea but the tea smelled burnt coffee. I changed the cup and filled it again, but again, the same issues. I assume the tea container was used for coffee then the kitchen staff filled it with tea. Bad idea for a 5 star so called luxury hotel.””

I got fried egg but the egg smelled bad once I put it on breast to eat it, tell the staff and she just smiled and sorry sir.

Not a happy experience but again, maybe I wasn’t lucky this time.

Thanks

data.formatted_address: Số nhà, 20 Bãi Cháy, Thành phố Hạ Long, Quảng Ninh 01119, Vietnam
data.name: Khách sạn Mường Thanh Grand Bãi Cháy

reviews.text:
The hotel is strategically located- great view of the port, cable car, cruise ships, and the famous sun wheel. It’s near a “by the bay” stalls where one can chill with cools drinks and the view of the bay. It’s near cafes and other restos.

The staff are attentive, friendly, and ready with a smile. Food served is delicious as well.

beautifully organised place located at the bank of Ha Long Bay. Rooms are well decorated and specious, neat and clean. Services are good. Breakfast is full of a variety of cuisines, having food keeping bay in the view is awesome. Over all, a good option who visits Ha Long Bay

This is right in front of the bay and is a clean and pleasant place. Local food, coffee, and some continental food places are in the vicinity. Rooms are well-maintained. Grab cabs are easily available. It is close to the Port office from where the Halong Bay cruise starts. The buffet is really good. Staff is friendly, especially the restaurant staff.

It was a SCAM hotel. It was a bad experience visiting Ha Long Bay for the first time. I booked the Muong Thanh hotel because I knew it was a famous hotel that was supposed to have good service. However, it was the complete opposite as I got scammed by the Muong Thanh hotel's driver service. Since it was my first time, I asked around to make sure about the price. Muong Thanh quoted me '1 way: 900 VND, 2 ways: 1100 VND.' I was fine with that price.

After Muong Thanh's driver picked me up and dropped off our family at the hotel, they explained that '2 ways' meant back and forth in a day, not a round trip that includes pick up from the airport, stay there, and then driving back to the airport. This meant their explanation indicated 4 ways, which they did not clarify earlier.

After getting scammed, I also called them to pretend to be a new customer asking about the pick-up service. They explained that a round trip meant picking up from the hotel and driving back to the airport after the stay there.

Upon calling them to inquire about the reason for the confusion, they offered me 200 VND back, but I declined it because I was extremely disappointed with their service. I could have booked outside for only 600 VND with a sedan car; I didn't need a 7-seat car. It was a clear case of a scam by the hotel

Unfortunately i only have pics of the view. The room is nothing exceptional. I stayed in a twin bedroom. It was small, no bathtub, nightlight wasn't screw on right. There's a weight scale with no batteries. It's a 20 minutes walk to sunworld. Oh and bathroom light is yellow, made it kind of hard for my friend to do her make-up. There's only one key card, you have to put a deposit of 50.000 VND for another one (you get it back once you return the card). There's a gym, a spa (with additional fee), an indoor pool.

data.formatted_address: Lot. 26 Tuần Châu, Thành phố Hạ Long, Quảng Ninh, Vietnam
data.name: Orchid Trendy Cruise

reviews.text: We had two amazing nights on the Orchid Trendy cruise. Our room was fantastic with beautiful views of the bay. The activities were well organised and fun. Mr Dong made our experience very easy and was very informative and funny. Gin and Ruby in the restaurant/bar were very friendly and helpful. Would highly recommend.

The cruise was a wonderful experience. We loved every second and especially love the food!  Nancy was our waiter and so kind! The staff are all very friendly and helpfull. I would highly recommend this trip.

It’s unfortunate I have to give a 1 star review because there were helpful staff and good experiences on this cruise.

The negatives:

Staff insist on playing bass heavy music during breakfast and dinner. It’s not appropriate for the otherwise white-glove level of formal setting they have.  I queried why this was happening and requested they just turn down the bass and they said they would “after the presentation” and didn’t.  I’m unsure why you would play pumped up bass heavy music at 7:15am in the morning that can even be heard in the rooms.  When the music wasn’t bass heavy it was still questionable as to the type of ambience they wanted to set and myself, my brother and father all at different occasions commented that the music was a poor choice.  I think it’s very easy to put on relaxing/appropriate music that would suit most and this wasn’t it. The fact I gave them that feedback and they couldn’t alternate it was an easy win that they lost.

My father also was unhappy to find honey teas and sparkling waters that were offered during meal services and seemingly included in the bill were in fact additional charges.

Emergency/assistance contact overnight was not communicated effectively enough.  The emergency contact is to dial 222 however this was said once during the opening speech and what I thought was said was to *go* to room 222.  Ok I misunderstood and I bare some responsibility for that but I only had one opportunity to take in this important information and had no idea I had not understood it correctly until I needed it and it was too late and no-one was around to ask.  I was very unwell in the middle of the night and had to wander around an empty ship unable to find room 222 (my room was 201 so the assumption is it would be close and on the same level) and went on to have a mild panic attack as I felt like I was going to pass out from heat exhaustion.  This was followed by bouts of diarrhoea which I cannot blame them for but I suspect may have been due to the ice in drinks I had.  It is not their fault I was unwell, even if it was the ice, but they were completely unable to help me and left me in a vulnerable and potentially embarrassing situation.

Later in the morning at about 7:00am I approached a staff member in the breakfast area and advised I had been unwell and wanted assistance and if they had any medication that would settle my stomach.  The staff said he would get someone else to help, asked for my room number and advised I could return to my room.  Well over an hour has passed and I heard nothing further.  Unbelievable and unforgivable.  I am still sitting in the room recovering as I write this.

————-

Seperate to all this - special shout out to the waiter whose name I think was Nani? He was very accommodating and my family particularly enjoyed his service and manner.  Other staff also friendly and helpful for the most part - there are a lot of them.

Absolutely amazing experience. Fantastic crew, delicious food and luxury rooms. The boat is very clean and the views are stunning. We had Nani who ran the dining room and bar team. Him and his team went above and beyond. Very high class. My wife and I would recommend to all ages
Wonderful cruise and great staff! The rooms were quite clean and had all amenities. We went for a 3D2N cruise, which we felt was much better way to explore the area than the 2D1N of you've time.

data.formatted_address: Giếng Đáy, Hạ Long, Quảng Ninh, Vietnam
data.name: Ga Hạ Long

reviews.text: The station is currently served a pair of trains (51501 from Yen Vien, 51502 to Yen Vien) which is mostly used by locals to ship their goods to the market on the platforms of station. The market is truly an interesting event, which lasts until the train departs back to Yen Vien, but otherwise both the station and the surroundigs are quite abandoned.
Vast and beautiful. Trains arrive and leave here periodically. See the time table for detail.
Good!

data.formatted_address: X344+FG6, Bãi Cháy, Thành phố Hạ Long, Quảng Ninh, Vietnam
data.name: Queen Cable Car (Tower 2)

reviews.text: It is completed but hasn't been used since the completion.
A beautiful aerial view
Weryh
Great

The 2016 Golden World Record, the largest ropeway, can accommodate up to 230 people on the upper and lower floors. The one-way journey takes 8 minutes. One side has a sea view, the other side is the city, and you can ride the Ferris wheel at the other end. You can go around in 15 minutes. It is best to go at 17:00 so that you can enjoy the day and night views at once

I think that it's one of the best living houses in Ha Long.
The apartment is fantastic, but the hot water in the one bathroom did not work.

data.formatted_address: Yết Kiêu, Trần Hưng Đạo, Thành phố Hạ Long, Quảng Ninh, Vietnam
data.name: Sun Wheel

reviews.text:
It was a great experience. Nice City view. I would suggest evening time to visit Sun Wheel as the City night view is The Best with different lightings etc.

The journey starts with a cable car. Cable car takes from Sun World (reception) to Sun Wheel. There are a couple of options to go for. Some are part of your ticket and others need separate tickets (tickets available at the fun activity places).

Sun wheel, Museum, Koi Bridget, Zen Park, Car rides etc were part of the ticket and enjoyable.

Paid - 12D show & VR Galaxy were fun activities.

Overall, it was a great experience.
A very enjoyable experience. The entrance fee included the cable car ride, rides and exhibitions inside the park and the ferris-wheel. The views from the top were spectacular

The entrance ticket is very cheap.
Good service from everyone.

Everything was so new, I really loved it and i had a special time with my family. Suitable for all genders and ages.
It’s amazing for the first try witnessing the city lights of Halong. This ride is part of the package together with cable car. You can purchase a ticket at the sunworld ticket office.
Good place to recreation with family and children in weekend, the way to go sun wheel you have to use queen cable car price 360.000 Vnd, after arrive then go to upstair (2nd floor)
